item.title: Woodcutter anitrandom 1st script
item.dc:creator: @Deathguppy Deathguppy
item.description:
@Deathguppy wrote:

I haven’t tested it yet but it looks okay ;D but wheres the antirandom?
And This

program chopatree; {.include srl/srl.scar} {.include srl/srl/skill/woodcutting.scar} const treecolor1=15123344; timetochop=15000;

Should look like…

program chopatree; {.include srl/srl.scar} {.include srl/srl/skill/woodcutting.scar} const treecolor1=15123344; //This is the tree colour timetochop=15000; //How to should it wait?

Just to help the noobies :rolleyes:

item.title: Woodcutter anitrandom 1st script
item.dc:creator: @r0bert r0bert
item.description:
@r0bert wrote:

tell me if i messed up please

[code=actionscript]program chopatree;
{.include srl/srl.scar}
{.include srl/srl/skill/woodcutting.scar}

const
treecolor1=15123344;
timetochop=15000;

procedure chop;
begin
if(findcolorspiraltolerance(x,y,treecolor1,msx1,msy1,msx2,msy2,25))then
mmouse(x,y,3,3)
if(IsUpTextMulti(‘chop’,‘op do’,‘down’))then
begin
mouse(x,y,3,3,true)
end;
end;

procedure treewait;
begin
wait(timetochop)
end;

procedure;
findnormalrandoms;

begin
cleardebug;
setupsrl;
activateClient;
repeat
treewait;
chop;
until(false)
end.[/code]

Read full topic
